com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin

Class SequenceGraphFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.SequenceGraphFactory

  • public abstract class SequenceGraphFactory
extends Object
    A sequence graph factory is used for creating instances of SequenceGraphs every time a new document is viewed in the sequence viewer.

    A SequenceGraphFactory is provided from a plugin via GeneiousPlugin.getSequenceGraphFactories().

    Sequence graphs can be implemented in one of two ways.

    1. Document based graphs are based on some pre-calculated values stored in a document. These are used for graphs that require time-consuming calculation. While the user is editing a sequence or alignment, a document based graph becomes invalid and will no longer be displayed.
    2. Residue based graphs calculate values on the fly every time a document is viewed. These are used for simpler graphs such as hydrophobicity. Graphs that may sometimes require a small amount of time-consuming calculation (such as the similarity graph on large alignments) can also be residue based graphs which support starting calculations in a background thread when necessary. Residue based graphs have the advantage that they are relevant while the user is editing a sequence or alignment.
    Instead of implementing this class directly, you may wish to use DefaultSequenceGraphFactories instead which allows creating sequence graphs from simpler interfaces. The following is an example of how to create such a graph: 
    
 public SequenceGraphFactory[] getSequenceGraphFactories(){
        //the scorer allows you to assign a score for each residue, and also assign a color to each score.
        DefaultSequenceGraphFactories.SingleSequenceScorer scorer = new DefaultSequenceGraphFactories.SingleSequenceScorer(){
            public Double getScore(char residue) {
                return Math.random();
            }

            public Color getColor(double score) {
                return Color.black;
            }
        };

        return new SequenceGraphFactory[]{
            DefaultSequenceGraphFactories.createSingleSequenceGraphFactory("Nucleotide Ludicrousity", "What a ludicrous graph!", true, 25, SequenceDocument.Alphabet.NUCLEOTIDE, scorer, false), //a bar graph
            DefaultSequenceGraphFactories.createSingleSequenceGraphFactory("Protein Ludicrousity", "What a ludicrous graph!", true, 25, SequenceDocument.Alphabet.PROTEIN, scorer, true) //a line graph
        };
    }

      SequenceGraph createDocumentBasedGraph(AnnotatedPluginDocument document)
      Deprecated. 
      This method causes ambiguity about whether the Alignment of Sequence aspect of a CombinedAlignmentAndSequenceDocument is required so is no longer used on CombinedAlignmentAndSequenceDocuments. All implementations should instead implement createDocumentBasedGraphForAlignment(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.AnnotatedPluginDocument) or createDocumentBasedGraphForSequence(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.AnnotatedPluginDocument).
      SequenceGraph createDocumentBasedGraphForAlignment(AnnotatedPluginDocument document)
      Create a new document based Alignment Graph.

    • Method Detail

      • createResidueBasedGraph

        public abstract SequenceGraph createResidueBasedGraph(SequenceDocument.Alphabet alphabet,
                                    boolean isAlignment,
                                    boolean isChromatogram,
                                    boolean isContig)
        Create a new residue based SequenceGraph for a sequence or alignment.

        In addition to the properties provided as parameters to this method, other properties are available (e.g. sequence name,circularity, trimmed regions) via SequenceGraph.getSequencePropertyRetriever()

        Parameters:
        alphabet - the alphabet of the current sequence or alignment (either protein or nucleotide)
        isAlignment - true if this is for a graph of an alignment rather then a single sequence. Alignment graphs are displayed below the final sequence in an alignment. Sequence graphs are displayed beneath each sequence. A SequenceGraph created for an alignment will be supplied with a list of sequences in SequenceGraph.setResidues(java.util.List, java.util.List, boolean). A SequenceGraph created for a single sequence will be supplied with singletonList in SequenceGraph.setResidues(java.util.List, java.util.List, boolean).
        isChromatogram - True if this document is a NucleotideGraph (chromatogram). If a graph wishes to only be available for chromatograms then it can take this parameter into account. In the case of an alignment (where isAlignment is true), this parameter will only be true if all sequences in the alignment are chromatograms. Chromatogram information is made available to the graph via the second parameter in SequenceGraph.setResidues(java.util.List, java.util.List, boolean).
        isContig - true if this document is a contig alignment.
        Returns:
        a new SequenceGraph or null if this factory does not create graphs for the given parameters.

      • createDocumentBasedGraph

        @Deprecated
public SequenceGraph createDocumentBasedGraph(AnnotatedPluginDocument document)
        Deprecated. This method causes ambiguity about whether the Alignment of Sequence aspect of a CombinedAlignmentAndSequenceDocument is required so is no longer used on CombinedAlignmentAndSequenceDocuments. All implementations should instead implement createDocumentBasedGraphForAlignment(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.AnnotatedPluginDocument) or createDocumentBasedGraphForSequence(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.AnnotatedPluginDocument).
        Create a new document based SequenceGraph.
        Parameters:
        document - the document this graph applies to. AnnotatedPluginDocument.getDocumentOrNull() will be either a SequenceDocument or SequenceAlignmentDocument Any graph which is going to provide useful information on these should be operate on a class that extends one of these with additional state information attached.
        Returns:
        a new SequenceGraph or null if this factory does not create graphs for the given type of document

      • createDocumentBasedGraphForAlignment

        public SequenceGraph createDocumentBasedGraphForAlignment(AnnotatedPluginDocument document)
        Create a new document based Alignment Graph.
        Parameters:
        document - the document this graph applies to. AnnotatedPluginDocument.getDocumentOrNull() will be a SequenceAlignmentDocument Any graph which is going to provide useful information on these should be operate on a class that extends one of these with additional state information attached.
        Returns:
        a new SequenceGraph or null if this factory does not create graphs for the given type of document
